Name: Mallet
Description: Stone work was done with the help of bronze and copper chisels (see e.g. E.2480 and E.2543) and of wooden  mallets. This example, which comes from the excavations of Deir el-Bahari, was part of a type of mallet of piriform shape (see also E.1106 and E.1952), which was used for heavy work, notably in quarries, for the breaking of stone and for cutting slabs. On the middle part of the head, one distinguishes the traces of use caused by the chisels being pounded.
